title: Accessible Facilities
text-1: Pavement ramps are placed next to places such as crosswalks to let wheelchairs, strollers, etc. move past the raise of pavements.
text-2: Wheelchair ramps are an inclined plane installed in addition to stairs. Ramps permit wheelchair users, as well as people pushing strollers, carts, or other wheeled objects, to more easily access a building, or navigate between areas of different height.
text-3: Tactile paving is a system of textured ground surface indicators found on stairs and railway station platforms, to assist pedestrians who are vision impaired.
text-4: Tactile maps use raised surfaces so that a visually impaired person can feel them. Images can be made accessible to the visually impaired in various ways, such as verbal description, sound, or haptic feedback.
